    • Method Detail

      • createGameLevel

        public void createGameLevel(Map<String,Object> params,
                   ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<GameLevelResponse>> callback)
        Create a game level. Currently does NOT support game objects.

        Target API Endpoint: /level/create

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The game application key to save the level for.
        • SirqulKeys.name
          The name of the level.
        • SirqulKeys.description
          The description of the level.
        • SirqulKeys.difficulty
          The difficulty, possible values are: VERY_EASY, EASY, MEDIUM, HARD, VERY_HARD.
        • SirqulKeys.appVersion of type AppVersion
          The version number of the application required to correctly load/play the level.
        • SirqulKeys.assetImageId
          The asset Id of the level image.
        • SirqulKeys.assetIconId
          The asset Id of the level icon.
        • SirqulKeys.gameData
          The game level data: xml, json, or other text based format.
        • SirqulKeys.gameDataSuffix
          The game level data format type.
        • SirqulKeys.visibility
          Is the level visible to others, possible values are: PUBLIC, PRIVATE.
        • SirqulKeys.friendGroup
          Make the level be readable by all friends.
        • SirqulKeys.connectionIds
          Make the level be readable by connections in this list.
        • SirqulKeys.connectionGroupIds
          Make the level be readable by connection groups in this list.
        • SirqulKeys.balance
          Set the amount of money available to spend, once 0 deactivate level. Set to a negative value for unlimited.
        • SirqulKeys.active
          If true set the game level as active. Default is false.
        • SirqulKeys.allocateTickets
          If true then scoring will give tickets. Default is false.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse< GameLevelResponse>
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        GameLevelApiBase.createGameLevel

      • getGameLevel

        public void getGameLevel(Map<String,Object> params,
                ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<GameLevelResponse>> callback)
        Get a game level. The level and account must be valid and have the appropriate permissions to view the content.

        Target API Endpoint: /level/get

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.levelId
          The id of the level to return.
        • SirqulKeys.includeGameData
          If true include the game level data, otherwise don't. default is false.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse< GameLevelResponse>
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        GameLevelApiBase.getGameLevel

      • getGameLevelsByApplication

        public void getGameLevelsByApplication(Map<String,Object> params,
                              ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<GameLevelListResponse>> callback)
        Get a list of levels for an application, just those the account has permissions to view.

        Target API Endpoint: /level/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the app key
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          Match the keyword to the owner name or level name.
        • SirqulKeys.start
          Start the result set at some index.
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          Limit the result to some number.
        • SirqulKeys.appVersion of type AppVersion
          The maximum version of the level to return.
        • SirqulKeys.includeGameData
          If true include the game level data, otherwise don't. default is false.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse< GameLevelListResponse>
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        GameLevelApiBase.getGameLevelsByApplication

      • getGameLevelsByBillableEntity

        public void getGameLevelsByBillableEntity(Map<String,Object> params,
                                 ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<GameLevelListResponse>> callback)
        Searches on game levels that the logged in user has access to. A user would have access if the creator of the game level is managed under the same BillableEntity.

        Target API Endpoint: /level/searchByBillableEntity

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The application key
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          The keyword used to search
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The column to sort the search on
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          The order to return the search results
        • SirqulKeys.activeOnly
          Return only active results
        • SirqulKeys.start
          The record to begin the return set on
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          The number of records to return

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        WrappedResponse<GameLevelListResponse> on valid response, SirqulResponse on invalid response.
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        GameLevelApiBase.getGameLevelsByBillableEntity

        public void removeGameLevel(Map<String,Object> params,
                   ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Get a game level. The level and account must be valid and have the appropirate permissions to view the content.

        Target API Endpoint: /level/delete

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.levelId
          The id of the level to delete.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:

        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call.       • updateGameLevel

        public void updateGameLevel(Map<String,Object> params,
                   ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<GameLevelResponse>> callback)
        Update a game level. Currently does NOT support game objects.

        Target API Endpoint: /level/update

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The logged in user.
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key to save the level for.
        • SirqulKeys.levelId
          If update then include the level Id.
        • SirqulKeys.name
          The name of the level.
        • SirqulKeys.description
          The description of the level.
        • SirqulKeys.difficulty
          The difficulty, possible values are: VERY_EASY, EASY, MEDIUM, HARD, VERY_HARD.
        • SirqulKeys.appVersion of type AppVersion
          the version number of the application required to correctly load/play the level.
        • SirqulKeys.assetImageId
          The asset Id of the level image.
        • SirqulKeys.assetIconId
          The asset Id of the level icon.
        • SirqulKeys.gameData
          The game level data: xml, json, or other texted based format.
        • SirqulKeys.gameDataSuffix
          The game level data format type.
        • SirqulKeys.visibility
          Is the level visible to others, possible values are: PUBLIC, PRIVATE.
        • SirqulKeys.friendGroup
          Make the level be readable by all friends.
        • SirqulKeys.connectionIds
          Make the level be readable by connections in this list.
        • SirqulKeys.connectionGroupIds
          Make the level be readable by connection groups in this list.
        • SirqulKeys.balance
          Set the amount of money available to spend, once 0 deactivate level.
        • SirqulKeys.active
          If true set the game level as active. Default is false.
        • SirqulKeys.allocateTickets
          If true then scoring will give tickets.

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        error SirqulResponse, success a WrappedResponse< GameLevelResponse>
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        GameLevelApiBase.updateLevel(...)
